title: Compassionate treatment and care
body:
Our mother was admitted to E2 with Covid, dad was already at the Hallamshire on Q1.
As an elderly lady with a number of serious underlying conditions the odds were stacked against her. It’s impossible to sufficiently thank everyone involved in mum and dads care.
The medical teams were honest and compassionate in all their dealings with us, her family.
The ward staff care for her and us throughout her stay was incredible and nothing was too much trouble.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: 5* rating!
body: I am at Holt Medical Practice but was fortunate enough to come to the surgery to have my Covid-19 vaccine. I must say how impressed I was with the efficiency and organisation of the practice. The staff were so friendly and kind to me. I have mobility issues and they offered me a chair while I waited. Like a well oiled machine, the procedures were thorough and well managed in a timely fashion. Not once did I feel that I was being rushed.  I tried to say to as many staff as I could how very grateful I am for all what they are doing to try and stamp out the horrors of the deadly virus. I really do applaud you all! Thank you for such a positive experience.

title: Quick, efficient 2nd COVID jab
body: Notified by letter of my 2nd jab, 11 weeks after the first, all on time & as expected. Vaccination arrangements at Leadenhall very well organised, queue moved fast. Staff friendly as well as efficient. Very grateful!

title: Great service
body:
I was rushed by ambulance to Accident and Emergency for a mental health crisis. Despite the staff was extremely busy and the major trauma were full, all the nurseries and the doctor treated me with kindness and patience. The Liason Phsychiatry Team came to visit me extremely quickly and they had great care to talk to me and give me advice. After a long consultation with them, I feel quite relieved and more calm. I had a plan to solve my problems and a team to support me. 
 Thank you Kingston hospital for the great care and the amazing job you are doing during this tough time!

title: COVID-19 VACCINE
body: My experience was very good.   I got in before my appointment time and was dealt with quickly and efficiently, with  friendly staff.

title: Helpful Staff
body:
I phoned the surgery recently to ask for advice regarding booking a test.The receptionist was very helpful,listened to my concerns , reassured me and was able to offer me an alternative date to the one that I had previously been given.
I have been with this practice for 15+ years and am overall very pleased with the service that they offer.
I had to wait a while for my call to be answered but that is to be expected at this time when the demand to speak to or see a GP is at an unprecedented high.
In my opinion the practice deserves a good review that reflects the service that I got.Thank you.

title: Excellent care
body: I had my dermatology appointment at 9.15. After a pleasant booking in I was greeted by a female HCA who introduced herself to me, I think that says a lot. I was called in by my dermatologist who greeted me with kindness & professionalism, I was treated according to my concerns in a kind manner.  As I waited in two outpatient areas I assessed how clean & tidy it was amongst busy staff dealing with their workload. I know the nhs doesn’t always get it right but due to pressures of extreme workload! I think they are a blessing! Well done!

author: Lion61
title: Feeling well after my sigmoid colectomy
body:
After many years of suffering terrible discomfort and pain from Diverticulitis. I was was diagnosed with a fistula caused by the Diverticulitis, a connection between my bowel and bladder. Causing further discomfort and pain, water infections, and regular antibiotics. I was admitted to hospital in March 2021.  
I would like to thank consultant surgeon Mr McDermott at the Royal Devon & Exeter Hospital for his diagnosis and subsequent surgery, and all the staff involved in my surgery. I would also like to thank all the the staff on Mere ward following my surgery and recovery. The care I received was excellent and I can’t thank you all enough. Your dedication and professionalism was truly exemplary, especially in these covid-19 times.  
Once again thank you Mr McDermott and your team. It is now 10 weeks from my surgery, and I haven’t felt this good and well for many years. You don’t know how ill you were until you're better.

author: DeeB34
title: Kind staff for my colonoscopy
body:
I went for a colonoscopy in Treliske and was a little apprehensive as it seemed a little daunting, especially as we had to time our journey in line with holiday traffic.  
Was a little bit tense by the time we arrived. There was no need however, as the staff were most kind and explained everything I needed to know. All of the staff were most helpful and put my mind at rest.  
The procedure was less uncomfortable than expected with a little bit of help from an injection which called me out a little.  
I thank the staff for their kindness.

author: MrsM59
title: Trying to get my mother's knee examined
body:
My Mother has attempted to be assessed at A&E twice in the past 10 weeks and both times a triage nurse has not allowed her to be seen by orthopaedic staff.  
My Mother, whilst working, felt and heard a crack in her knee, it is swollen, extremely painful and she is unable to walk on it. A&E at Crosshouse have fobbed her off twice and her GP surgery have done the same.  
Disgraceful service.

author: Ten jobs
title: Thank you to mid-Notts respiratory service
body:
Just finished a 6 weeks pulmonary rehabilitation course with Alex. I have previously done 3 courses before with a group but now that my health has deteriorated I cannot walk as I used to.  
Alex suggested that I do the 6 week course at home and she would put me through the first day to achieve my fitness levels. She monitored me throughout and made me feel safe and at ease.  
I am hoping to get back on the lung transplant programme so keeping up my fitness is very important. Alex keeps in touch every two weeks to make sure I am doing ok. I do my exercises with my own programme now.  
Thanks to the excellent respiratory service.

author: Emmrd63
title: IMHA on Tenby Ward, Caswell Clinic
body: Thank you for corresponding with my solicitor with all the facts and necessary details, an excellent piece of work!

author: encryptionkz74
title: I can not praise the team highly enough
body:
I fell on two occasions in 2020 and broke my lower left arm - both bones. After I came out of plaster and completed the 3 Zoom sessions of physiotherapy with my local hospital trust, my GP referred me to the Falls & Fracture prevention team.  
Initially I was assessed by telephone by Angela and referred for a bone mineral density scan - Angela promptly followed the results up and wrote to my GP recommending medication for osteoporosis that the scan had identified. She then arranged for the Bromley F & F team get in touch.  
At a time when I can not even see my GP, Laura, a physiotherapist in the team, visited me at home, did a thorough assessment, identified that I suffered from a benign vertigo, and carried out a manipulation that has greatly improved matters.  
I was then contacted for the supporting 12 week exercise programme on Zoom, yet Tracey visited me at home to take me through the exercises I would be doing in the Zoom class - and came back at the end of the programme to assess the progress made.  
I can not praise the team, including Joan, highly enough, a GREAT TEAM! who rebuilt my confidence and took seriously things like my dizziness, that had been dismissed at my hospital trust as not being relevant.

title: Outstanding service user experience
body: Dear Practice Manager, please may I say what a pleasure it was to speak with you earlier. As we briefly discussed in the surgery, I would like to offer my most sincere thanks to all your reception team. Sadly it is all to uncommon to receive excellent service theses days however, I have to say they are an absolute credit to your organisation. I have seen first hand how theses ladies work non-stop dealing with an enormous and incredibly important workload, their dedication, hard work and polite efficiency sets them head and shoulders above every surgery I have ever had to contact and to go above and beyond, as they do, in these challenging times is testimony to their commitment. I cannot say enough sincerely nice things about the way they handled my contact with the surgery and they truly are the unsung heroes of primary care. Not forgetting of course the consulting Doctor, who was equally courteous, professional and accommodating so a big thank you to him for allowing me to trouble him when I know the huge case load GPs have. I know that being the public face of an organisation and all it brings has unique challenges at times however, all your staff have displayed the most exemplary assistance and kindness. Thank you all so very much for such an excellent experience, I hope you all receive the recognition for your efforts and resolve that you have earned. Sincerest thanks again and very kindest regards N

title: Bad Customer service
body: The staffs sounds very unwilling to answer the calls. Recently lost my son`s prescription after getting in touch calling 11 times. Doctor is always rushing to finishing the call. Not interested in any other health issues apart from the issue told on phone to book the appointment.

title: Utterly wonderful
body: I was admitted to A and E and afterwards to Lewes ward on Saturday, 22nd March. I had no idea that I had heart problems. I was in hospital for 4 days and underwent an angioplasty. Throughout my time in A and E, on Lewes Ward and during the procedure in Cardiology, I received the very best care. Everyone was calm and kind and had the very highest professional standards. The skills of the cardio team were awe inspiring. I cannot thank everyone enough.

readBy.name: Digestive Diseases Centre, Royal Sussex County Hospital

title: Terrible lack of communication
body: On booking my first Covid injection in early March I asked the receptionist what would happen regarding the date of my second injection, which of course I would need within twelve weeks.  I was told the surgery would contact me closer to the time with a booking.  This did not happen.  At the nine week point I contacted the surgery to be told I was on the list and would be contacted nearer the time with appointment details.  This did not happen.  At the end of week eleven I contacted them again.  I was told the receptionist would check and get back to me.  This did not happen.  I am now 6 days from the twelve week point and the receptionist has told me today that there are no appointments available at the minute but not to worry as its ok to go over the 12 weeks between Covid jabs.  Latest Gov guidelines have reduced the suggested time for over 50's to eight weeks so I am really not sure about that.   Receptionist then told me to call 119 and book my own jab as they could not do it. I did call 119 and now face a 120 mile round trip to get the second jab.  No issues with this really but I certainly do take issue with the lack service offered by my own GP surgery.  Shocking communication and little apparent care about patients concerns.

title: In Safe Hands
body: Unfortunately I suffered a stroke ( blood clot in the brain) and after calling 111 was taken by the paramedics to the stroke unit at Wycombe. From the moment I was admitted to when I left some 26 hours later I found the medical attention second to none. The whole of the stroke unit appeared to work as a team and everyone was friendly from the cleaners, porters, care assistants, nurses and doctors. I was really cared for whilst I was there.Very well done and a big thank you. I felt very safe when I was there and everyone was a credit to our fantastic National Health Service.

title: Dewsbury A&E
body: My husband attended  after a fall.  Very quick service,  friendly and  efficient,   couldn't ask for more of the wonderful staff or the NHS

author: aquilamk34
title: First visit to this clinic
body:
I was really nervous about going to the clinic, I was advised to by my GP as they had done a batch of tests but wasn't sure of the lumps/ulcers appearing.
I had no doubt that it wasn't anything STI related but was worrying over cancer as we all tend to do when we see a lump, especially if family members have had cancer.
I was also jittery as when I went to an SH clinic in another area previously, it was an horrendous experience. I had a Dr examining me and just put his fingers in me without asking or explaining what he was going to do and the nurses were so rude making me feel "dirty" or like an irresponsible teenager and then they sent confidential information to another address and that person opened it and knew me!
However, the staff were fantastic at this clinic, I wanted to tell them as I left but didn't have the time. From the triage phone call to reception staff to the nurse and doctor I saw; treated me with the most respect and dignity. They explained everything and were down to earth. Luckily it wasn't anything untoward at all just skin issues. I was given creams and some advice. All staff stayed professional and maintained confidentiality. I wouldn't be so nervous if I ever had to go again.
The only downside for me was that it's on the second floor and Im terrified of lifts having been stuck in them 3 times! But I used the stairs very slowly as I have lots of health issues, especially with mobility. But I made it there. The location itself is accessible and in the centre so easy for all to attend I'd imagine.

title: Simply the best
body: We have been registered with this practice for just over a year and can not sing their praises enough.  We very rarely have to visit but on the odd occasion for annual check up on review of medication, all of the staff we have encountered have been extremely helpful and caring.

title: Poor practice
body: Try making an appointment you get cut off for over an hour , get a queue system please instead of cutting off your patients discusting you operate in such a manner

title: Best Hospital in Greater Manchester
body: From my diagnosis in early May 2021. I have been greatly impressed by the total dedication and professionalism shown by all the staff. From the hygeine operatives to the consultant surgeon.The efficiency and cleanliness of the hospital 200% out of 100%

title: Booking an appointment
body: It is very inconvenient and difficult to book an appointment with the Doctor. You have to ring the reception in the morning at 8.00. The lines are so busy it took an hour to connect. You can’t ring during daytime as appointment are released on the day So it is difficult if you are working as you can’t take day off every time you have an appointment. If you starting work at 8:00 it is difficult to ring. Now due to Covid you are given phone appointment but they will ring you anytime not set time so I will have to be near my phone all the time. Is this the way you treat a patient who is sick and stressed about the sickness. The doctors and nurses are nice but the system of booking an appointment needs to be reviewed so that it is convenient to all patients.

title: Impossible to speak to a GP
body:
This morning I made 127 calls to the surgery.
On the 127th call I was placed in a queue 
I was 10th in that queue.
After a further 20 minutes. I was No 1 in the queue.
I was then told I couldn't make an appointment,
Because all the appointment had gone for the day.
And could I call back tomorrow.
What's more I was reprimanded by my boss for spending so much time on the phone.

author: earthgg47
title: Trying to sort my life out
body:
My story starts here if I never knew about this place I dont think I would be here the staff are fantastic always got time for everyone nothing is to much they listen to what you need to say and never judgemental love all of them xxx  
I came here and have never felt very welcome and I know I will get the help I need I fell safe and always in good company xand feel at ease when I leave x  
I cant believe ive found a place like this the staff are absolutly great and very helpful xxxx

author: bonanzaqj78
title: Residential  care
body: My relative has been In Rectory Field and I couldn't praise the staff enough. They are all welcoming and good at keeping me update. I am so glad she is here and well looked after I know she is safe and treated with respect and dignity.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent service
body:
Could not fault the service I received from this practice.
I rang for an emergency appointment at 8am, had a telephone appointment with the Doctor at 10am, and had an appointment at the practice at midday. The Doctor immediately diagnosed my illness and sent me to A&E. Upon arrival at the hospital, the receptionist and Doctor had already coordinated for me to head straight to the Surgical Assessment Unit. I had a few tests here, they confirmed the illness the Doctor had diagnosed, and had surgery later that same day.
Very impressed and thankful for the swift action from both the receptionist and Doctor at this practice.

author: aurigatt97
title: COVID test centre
body:
Christie greeted myself, and explained everything superbly. Her car side manner was second to none. A perfect experience.
The ability to have a test the same day as my op was fantastic and saved a 70 mile round trip which we have previously had to do on more than one occasion.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Surprised they are still going
body: I waited for over an hour on the phone and no one answered my call and I gave up. Reading about the bad reviews people have written here, I can relate and concur to all bad experiences people have had. Readings the reviews here and the articles written about this practice in the Oxford Mail I am still surprised that they are still here and  othing has been done about it yet.

author: precious21
title: new to CGL services
body: Four weeks ago i walked through the doors of GCL, with encouragement from my sister. It was a very nervous and frightening feeling until Steve one of the key workers greeted me with such a big welcoming smile , filled in the nessesary form and went through all the services provided by CGL. I instantly felt welcomed and cared for and most importantly felt i had choose the correct service which could help me change my life.

title: useless practice
body:
i have just spent i hour and 40 minutes in a queue only to be told there were no appoimtments available and to phone back after 1.00pm to try and make an appointment.
ridiculous system and needs looking at.
worst experience i have ever had on the internet and i,ve had some bad ones.
your whole system needs an overhaul including removing some of your unhelpful receptionists

title: Poor
body: Tried to ring from 8 o'clock phone always engaged when they  do answer to on hold after 10 minutes get cut off told to do email consultation but you have to  wait up to 4days for answer .Tried for 2 days reception staff rude.

title: Better than last time
body: Last time they disgracefully gave me the wrong personal details with wrong dob and wrong ethnicity. GDPR not followed. Today the correct details with correct ethnicity. Friendly helpful service with very little waiting time. They took a long time to answer the phone when booking appointment.

author: AGGGY
title: I love coming here
body: On a beginning I was alcohol user. I didn't know how to manage. With help of cgl and specially groups run by Andrea I was able to stop drinking and sort my life. The staff is very helpful with everything. The atmosphere is nice . I met lots of people like me safer with addiction. I love coming on Tuesday art club we can explore or different art techniques and enjoy outside space. I just love coming here

title: Terrible appointment booking system
body:
Much like other reviews, it's impossible to get an appointment as they only book on the day, requiring you to ring at 8.30am in the hopes you'll get through. It's reached the point where I have two phones side by side ringing for 30 minutes with no luck. When you try to message the doctors on their website, their response is 'to book a telephone appointment'. There's a real issue with trying to get bookings and has led to me having to ring 111 and get referred/booked into the Urgent Treatment Centre because I simply can't get through to see the GP. The receptionists are lovely and understanding, but you can see that it's out of their power.

Will be looking to change GP's as a result of this and I would recommend you avoid the practice.

title: So kind!
body: I went to have my second COVID jab here today and the experience was fantastic. I am quite phobic of needles and they made sure I was as comfortable as possible and every single person I encountered was so kind. They were quick and efficient and even when I was sobbing they were calm and professional. Massive thank you to all the volunteers and the doctors and nurses on site. You are brilliant!

title: Never got through
body: Call the surgery and get the ‘high volume of calls message’ continue to hold anyway as need this sorting out and it cuts you off after 5 minutes. Pressed for a call back, 2 hours later it came, was number 4 in the queue then after 5 minutes got cut off again. Absolutely impossible to speak to even reception let alone anyone else. How they are receiving a high volume of calls when no one can get through is beyond me. Appalling service, absolutely disgraceful. What are you actually doing in there all day?? Because it’s not speaking to patients!!

author: RDS1972
title: Kidney stone surgery
body: Attended day care surgery to get kidney stone surgery and the treatment I received was absolutely fantastic right from when I first entered the building till I left later on in the day. All staff members were so helpful and professional. Nothing was too much trouble and the care and attention I received was second to none. Surgeon Mrs Kerr could not have been any more professional. She knew I was a bag of nerves and explained absolutely everything to me in a very reassuring and caring way. Her comment of 'you don't do this every day but we do' was class and put me at ease. Mrs kerr, her team and all the staff who looked after me are a credit to the Hospital and I cannot thank you guys enough

title: Nice doctors
body: We had to phone up to start with but the doctor called us in to see my son. She was really nice and sorted out my little boy quickly.

author: Lab12
title: Efficient pathway between GP and Immediate assessment unit.
body:
I contacted my GP practice who gave me telephone consultation. I explained my symptoms and was then seen face to face by my GP the next day for an assessment. The GP then asked for a second opinion from her colleagues who then advised that I should attend the Acute Immediate assessment unit (AIAU) at the QEUH GG& C. I was then seen by a neurologist within an appropriate timeframe. I was DC and advised I would be seen as an outpatient.  
Unfortunately my symptoms worsened over the coming days and I revisited my GP. I was then advised again to attend the AIAU where I was admitted overnight to the acute stroke ward (1C) and referred for an urgent inpatient MRI. The scan department were extremely busy but managed to fit me in which I was extremely grateful for. This thankfully came back clear and I was then seen by a neurologist who gave me a diagnosis and a management plan.  
On DC I spoke with my GP to discuss my onwards management and again she could not have been more accommodating towards my concerns. I am astounded by the incredible level of care I have received over the past 3 weeks from all the professionals who were involved in my care. To commend them all - GP practice, namely Dr Berry and Dr Clark, AIAU receptionist, nurses, HCSW and Doctors of all levels. I appreciate this more than ever, especially after the past year that healthcare professionals have had and I am so grateful to these individuals for my efficient and caring journey through my diagnosis.

author: Jane59
title: Cancer treatment
body:
7 1/2 years after having breast cancer on the right side I was feeling reasonably happy that I was healthy again. After 5 yearly mammograms I was called for my routine one at Edgware Hospital. 3 days later I got a letter calling me back. I was given more mammograms, an ultrasound and a biopsy. The staff at this hospital were lovely, particularly when I was having the biopsy. A week later I went to Northwick Park Hospital for my results and was told I had cancer on the left side. This was just before Christmas and during COVID-19 times. I was given an appointment for a lumpectomy at Clementine Churchill hospital and opted to wait until January. Just before then I was told it would be delayed for a week - with everything that was going on with Covid at that time this was the only delay I experienced.  
I had a lovely surgeon, Mr Lee, a very kind man who took into account my own feelings about the scars I would have. At Clementine Churchill the team were great - I was very nervous about the anaesthetic after being very ill previously. This time was completely different and so very much better. I came round from the operation and was back in my room with some lunch in an hour! I was very impressed with care and kindness I was shown at this hospital.  
Since then I have seen Dr Gayadeen at Northwick Park Hospital who was very kind and gentle. I also had 5 days of radiotherapy at Mount Vernon Hospital under a super team of radiologists.  
It has not been easy having breast cancer again but I have been lucky. It was caught early, it was small, it was another primary cancer and I absolutely cannot fault the care I have been given. Obviously due to Covid I have missed out on seeing the breast care / MacMillan nurses but they are just at the end of the phone which is incredibly reassuring.  
I cannot fault the care I was given this time - thank you NHS

readBy.name: East and North Hertfordshire NHS Trust

author: incer
title: Unable to contact practice by phone
body:
Unable to get through on the phone after over 100 calls, very very poor.  
I feel this needs investigating.

author: stegm
title: My wife and her travels through the mental health minefield
body:
All of a sudden my wife was making crazy statements, she thought we had people in the loft, the neighbours wanted to kill her and our cat? I did not know where to turn or where to get help from, we had an incident where she went missing so I had to get help, and quickly! I was told to contact the mental health crisis team and seek their help, this I did and they told me to put down the phone and ring the police, this I did.  
Everything turned out fine but this was the very beginning of my adventure with the Nottinghamshire NHS Mental Health Support Team. I do now know after eighteen months of turmoil and dread that this was a pivotal moment in my wife and me coming to terms and dealing with my wife’s Illness.  
I and my wife have met some lovely people who have helped immensely since the early onset of her mental psychosis. I honestly thought my wife would not return to normality and our life going forwards would never be the same. We had dreams and plans for our future that seemed a million miles away from us now. And sometimes alone at night I would have a little cry over this as I felt robbed of our future.  
All I have said though with the right care and support from the mental health teams I was assured everything would be alright. I was not convinced because with every step we took forwards something unforeseen would come along and push us back again. But now eighteen months from the start of all of this we have a massive tunnel with a world full of light shining through it and allowing us to see our future again.  
All of this due to the efforts of so many people, the guys at Kings Mill Hospital for all the help they provided because we could not see our own GP, the Mental Health Crisis Team who became like an extension to our family, they helped us in ways too numerous to mention and they were so patient with my wife I can’t thank them enough.  
Then when our care was transferred to North Gate in Newark, into the wonderful hands of Louise the nursing care coordinator and the psychiatrist things started to change. They tweaked the medicines my wife was on and this was amazing. I now got to see my wife with a smile on her face again.  
She now rides again (horses) her passion since the age of eight, and slowly we are emerging into our world again the one I thought I would lose for ever. I now take part in the Newark Carer Support group with Laura E, Alice & Laura R this has given me an extra insight into the problem We have had and the way we can support each other.  
My wife also has joined Rob the CBTp Therapist Supervisor which my wife says has been a major breakthrough for her regarding her agoraphobia. All of the carers support and the new course I have just started Carer Education and Support Program were overseen by Andrea and Laura from the Family Interventions Team at Bassetlaw Hospital Worksop.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: PoxyRoxy1
title: Helpful team
body:
I find the whole team very helpful and they helped me when going through very bad periods of my life,  
I love attending appointments and always feel welcomed, I enjoyed all the various groups I attend at Wisbech, No matter how I felt, there was always someone to talk to. I recently found out I was Hepatitis C positive and Dawn supported me and never judged me, as did everybody they all helped me. I am due to start my Hep C treatment soon and feel very positive about this.  
I look forward to my next appointment.

author: Splash
title: They were amazing, professional, and caring
body: I went to the pilgrim hospital for a Gynaecological problem and was seen by steph and her team on B1. I had experienced a bad examination at another hospital by the Gynaecological doctor there, and as I had such outstanding care by steph and her team before I request thus time to have them again. I was extremely worried what they would find wrong with me, cancer being most in my mind, but once again they were amazing, professional, and caring, I was put st ease immediately and please to say got the all clear and discharged from their care. I would highly recommend anyone with a similar problem to ask to be seen by them.

author: lotsofdogs
title: Speech therapy
body: It was really good to have Margaret involved over a couple of years because she got to know us, knew what we needed and was able to point us in the right direction for all sorts of ways of supporting us. It's been really valuable. She's done what she can now but we're sorry that we won't be seeing her again - it's been helpful to have her advice and know that she has been checking on how things are going and telling us different things at different visits as she's seen what we need.

readBy.name: Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)

author: hydruskp59
title: The least we can expect is for Doctors to be well prepared
body:
Forth Valley Royal Hospital Cardiology unit should be part of my multi discipline team looking after me following my diagnosis of severe heart Failure. I am also seeing face to face the national heart failure service in Glasgow however as I understand it I still need to be under the care of Forth Valley as this is where I will be sent should I suffer a episode and require Immediate hospital assistance.  
I have only met my cardiologist once before and that was back in December last year after my initial diagnosis by a private cardiologist and at the time the cause of my illness was not understood & I had only just started to be prescribed the required medicines for my conditions. Since then I have had three echocardiograms one of which was at fourth Valley Hospital and 2 MRI scans. The results of these and consultation notes have all been copied into my cardiologist. So, When this doctor phoned me I was extremely surprised that they hadn’t taken the time to read any of this information sent to them and the only pieces of information they had was their notes of December last year and a list of my current medication. Since their notes were written the assumption that the cause of my condition was caused by the infection had been disproved by the 2MRI scans. As well this doctor had not spoken to the heart nurse who they said was responsible for increasing my medication. How can I have confidence in a unit when they do not take the time to read correspondence and results sent to them. They even suggested making a change to my current medication without knowing the full history. I do not understand what my cardiologist expected to get out of the consultation as they clearly showed no interest in understanding what had happened in the last seven months regarding my treatment. All its done for me is give me additional stress and concern.As patients we are expected to attend appointments, provide information as requested, surely the least we can expect is for Doctors to be well prepared. I certainly will be looking to understand how I can change my cardiologist as this episode has left me with no confidence in FVRH.

author: cliff95
title: Helped more than you will ever know
body:
Just would like to say if it wasnt for Andrea the other day taking her time listening to me and go on about private matters then I dread to think where I would really be so thank you so much for taking that much time on the phone with me. It really did stop me from doing anything I would have later regret so thank you from the bottom of my heart Andrea really went out of her way to help me.  
That's a good addiction worker I am lucky as my key worker has been amazing and the time I have had a good rant and been annoyed with the NHS down here she has managed to steer me through the rage and by the end of my call I have totally seen sense.  
My workers name is Lorraine now my final we bit is for this amazing woman called Dawn she's not my keyworker hasnt been for a long time now but that woman has helped me so much what an amazing addiction worker her and Andrea have really helped me so thankyou because cgl wouldnt be cgl without these 3 workers so looking forward to my ankle healing then get some volunteering so I can one day hopefully work in addiction and work with them in homeless too so thankyou Andrea, Lorraine and Dawn yous really have helped me more than yous will ever no thank you.x

author: castorgh37
title: COVID vaccination
body: The staff at Officer Club/Argos in Glenrothes were amazing and reassuring. Special mention to Elaine and the nurse (whose name I can’t remember)

author: ariesbc64
title: Friendly staff
body: It was my first time at the clinic and even though I was nervous, the staff were very friendly and make it a comfortable environment.

author: Debs101
title: Iris Ward - runs like clockwork
body:
I have just had decompression neck surgery in King Georges Hospital Chadwell Heath.  
The patient care in this hospital is unprecedented. There is a nurse for every patient. The organisation of patients and surgerys is run like clockwork The cleanliness is phenomenal, I could eat my dinner off of the floor. I am on a covid free ward ( iris ward) but have been told this is how the hospital runs normally.  
All of the nurses are caring and concerned extremely helpful and pleasant. My nurse Toni is amazing as im sure they all are but she also has children at home so hats off to her.  
I can quite honestly say after having had life changing surgeries where mistakes were made. ( In a different hospital) that this experience has restored my faith in hospitals. I won't say NHS because thats always been amazing. Different hospitals do make a difference! I would fully recommend to anybody with any kind of back problems in this area to be referred to Dr Sadek and his team.  
I would like to say a huge thank you to all of the many doctors and nurses that have seen me today!

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Debsdoo78
title: Covid 19 testing cell for my son
body:
My 9 year old attended the testing cell for a Covid swab as he is due to have some teeth removed. My son was really nervous but the chap performing the swab made him relaxed and comfortable.
He was very professional and also
Knew how to speak to my son on his level. He made the whole experience a happy one.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Anonymous1234567
title: Disappointment at ent appointment
body:
I went to an appointment at the ENT clinic today at Rotherham hospital after experiencing symptoms such as a blocked nose, headaches, tiredness etc. for 18 months that have been making my life miserable. I was pleased when they said they would be using a camera to look into my nose and throat as I thought this could finally lead to these issues getting resolved.  
After this happened, I remember feeling confused about why the doctor only put the camera into the front of my left nostril and this was not explained to me. Once I was called back in to discuss what they found, I was told everything was normal and that my symptoms were due to my “anxiety” and was directly told there’s nothing we can do for you.  
I was also told that I should go back to my GP which also confused me because my GP had already prescribed me everything they could to help with these symptoms and none of it helped, so how will they be able to help me now? I left feeling completely defeated and like I was crazy because the physical symptoms I’m experiencing were chalked up to my anxiety like they always are.  
I now feel completely out of hope and like I will have to be miserable for the rest of my life if even the experienced medical staff couldn’t help me. So I will be going back to my GP and asking to be referred to another hospital for a second opinion.  
Extremely disappointed with the service I received.

author: MandyC
title: Well done Day Surgery Unit
body: Was at the Day Surgery Unit in Craigavon Area Hospital today.   Thank you to Nursing staff & Consultant who looked after me.   They were kind, compassionate & very caring.   Well done to SHSCT for such a high quality & efficient service.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Ergo
title: Operation on my hand
body:
Towards the end of May I attended St John's hospital in Livingston to have an outpatient operation on my hand, and I was blown away by the brilliant service given by both the outpatient day clinic and operating teams.  
They achieved a great balance between being knowledgeable/efficient and being attentive/reassuring/friendly.  
The pre-op information I was given was thorough, but delivered informally to keep me from being apprehensive. I was taken to theatre last so was hanging around quite a long time and could have started to feel anxious, however on a regular basis one of the staff checked in with me to have a chat, offer me food and a drink, and check I was OK. In the theatre someone sat beside me and chatted to me the whole time, to make sure I stayed relaxed. The surgeon was chatty and reassuring. A nice touch post-op was to give me a heated blanket to make me comfortable.  
I might have thought I had just been lucky, but I subsequently spoke to a friend who had also had the same operation at St John's and, unsolicited, they mentioned how wonderful the teams had been.  
Please pass on my thanks to the relevant people.

author: coop4418
title: Combined Gastroscopy and Colonoscopy
body: Not the most comfortable of procedures but was well looked after by doctors and nurses. After tea and toast was able to drive home. No side effects the next day. Feeling good.

author: Amada
title: Break into a new beginning
body:
I had a break up, I felt it was so extreme, that I had no idea why these emotions were so intense. During the journey on the therapy I discovered different situations from my past where I touched that pain and I was not able to process it at that moment.  
I'm very grateful for the service of the IAPT. My infinite gratitude to my therapist Shole. She helped me so much to see within myself those experiences that I needed to bring to the surface as in a way they were coming out through my present situation. Dynamic Interpersonal Therapy was the right approach for me during this difficult period, I feel it was crucial for my self development and self awareness. I hope more and more people get access to this wonderful process for their own self growth and the improvement of their lives.

author: Vkl
title: York Hospital a&e paediatrics
body:
Taking my 2 year old to A&e in york was a smooth and easy process thanks to the fabulous care and attention of Dr Besai and staff nurse felicity. They were kind and professional and made us both comfortable as well as diagnosing and treating my toddler quickly. Thank you.  
The Paediatric area in A&E is a massive advantage for York - it makes a difficult experience far easier for parents and children.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Steven B.
title: Lost our fetus, without anyone to help, totally devastated from Maternity care unit
body:
This Maternity system and the lack of communication, and nobody to care for my wife is totally a shame! It's been more than two weeks now that we have lost our fetus(which we were trying for many years to have) and the appointed Midwife has not contacted my wife, not even a sympathetic I'm sorry for your loss sms is been sent! Never seen a doctor, even after diagnosed(from telephone Midwife) as difficult pregnancy. Feeling like there are no personnel, and no compassion! No actual professional help whatsoever, just a receptionist saying: If you have severe bleeding come to A&E. Meaning it felt like to us-don't bother us, just stay there and wait for your fetus to die! I'm so disappointed,devastated and angry with the lack of professionalism and compassion! I could not recommend this place.  
Where to begin...I think I'm not gonna go into details, my grief is so great to write, or comment anything more..

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: banter billy
title: admission and surgery
body: I was brought in today for a follow on procedure that was cancelled due to covid. I was anxious about what they would find but from the moment of my arrival I was put at ease and the nurses and carol, the domestic, were brilliant. I want to say a massive thank you to the theatre team and especially to the nurse (sorry I cant remember their name) whom held my hand as they tried to access a vein (was the only painful moment). I don't really want to pick someone out as they were all brilliant, from office staff to domestic staff - many many thanks again.

author: delphinuscw44
title: Covid vaccine
body: Sitting here post covid vaccine at Dunfermline East Church and just wanted to say thank you to all the great staff here. Very helpful, all happy and particularly my vacinator, Mhairi, was lovely and friendly and made everything so relaxed. Great job everyone, it is appreciated! !

author: inspirejm47
title: Wrist surgery
body: The staff at the fracture unit at Newcross Hospital were absolutely brilliant, especially an amazing lady called Amy. Having recently broken my wrist and having reconstructive surgery, the team at Newcross and Cannock Chase Hospital were fantastic. We need more special people like this in the world.

author: Ks433
title: Biopsy
body:
I went in to get a biopsy on my leg.  
It was over and done with in no time at all. Both David and Angela at the Stirling dermatology department where excellent. They put my mind at ease and explained everything that was going to happen and what would happen afterwards.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: brogs10
title: Covid Carnegie Vaccine Centre
body: I have a phobia of needles and have always passed out after receiving any vaccine or jag previously. Kirsten and Lizzy were both wonderful and helped me take my mind of getting the covid jag, this is the first time ever that I have not fainted after getting a jag. Thank you so much both, for helping me over come something so small but has made me feel so much better about getting my second dose.

author: Rt44
title: My stay as inpatient
body: I began becoming breathless and no energy. I was taken into the Victoria Hospital, I stayed there two weeks. I was then transferred to Letham Ward, Cameron Hospital. I found the staff very kind and caring, nothing was too much for them. If there was anything that could have been better it was the presentation of food and some of the flooring.

author: Respect Everyone
title: The midwives didn't treat me right or with respect
body:
From Theater to Recovery Ward, the staff who was working in that area (that time) was excellent, but not all midwives who works in 5 South were good. Some of them they don’t treat me with care.  
They know that I was first time mum, I need support and help from them especially it was Covid time, so no visitors allowed to stay with me at night.  
I had twins, so it’s difficult for me, I had caesarean delivery, I’m in adjustment period, why some of midwives in Royal Free doesn’t think that way. Then on my last night staying, they need to transfer me to isolation room.  
On following day, one of midwives asking me “what time my husband coming to pick me up?" Because she told me that they need the isolation room and need to clean it first before the other patient to come. I was surprised how she told me that and I felt that she wants to get rid of me immediately.  
My midwife who was assigned to me, we were just started, she just telling me in a rushing way about my discharge letter, medicines and health information. She did that because the other midwife needs the room that I was using. I felt these midwives didn’t treat me right, they didn’t respect me, they didn’t give me proper health education or any health information.  
I felt that they don’t deserve their profession. Some of them, maybe they don’t know the right meaning of maternity, ante/post natal care or even their profession called "midwife".  
I chose to deliver my babies in Royal Free because I thought I was in a safe environment, with genuine caring and to be with professional midwives, but I regret it. I had post partum depression. I hope unprofessional midwives will have further training and continuous supervision. They should know how to give support, help and care to all mothers who just had delivered their babies (normal or caesarean delivery), whether first time mum or many times.  
If they don’t improve, they should go back to university and study again. They should learn their professional ethics and responsibilities.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

author: Lings Bar
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Heartfelt Thanks
body:
To all the staff of Castle ward,  
With heartfelt thanks for all your kindness and devotion to the care of our mother.  
We will never forget your sympathy for our concerns and Mums comfort.  
Thanks You  
From all the family  
Grand children  
Great grand children and partners of.

author: mfin567
title: Professional staff
body: I went to the X ray department at Omagh hospital and all the staff were very friendly and professional, there was very little waiting around and I was seen quickly. I cant say that anything could have been improved.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Plum93
title: Exceptional care at Peterhead Maternity Unit
body:
I would like to say a huge thank you to all the midwives and supporting staff at Peterhead Community midwife unit for the fantastic care I received.  
I recently gave birth to our second baby here and previously had our first child here 3 years ago. The antenatal care was great throughout both pregnancies and I was even fortunate enough to have the same midwife for both, making a big difference to the continuity of care.  
The care during delivery was exceptional and I will forever be grateful to the midwives and student midwife who helped me through the most perfect birth. I will always have fond memories of my deliveries thanks to the friendly and caring staff and I always make sure to recommend PCMU to pregnant women.  
Thank you and keep being your fantastic selves!

author: indigocf38
title: Covid jab
body: Everything was well set out, everyone was friendly and explained everything clearly to me

author: hscdoer&user67
title: Visiting a very busy ED with my father
body:
I mid-May I was directed by GP to take my father, an older man of 88 years, to ED due to excruciating pain in his lower back. The GP stated that his practice would not be able to complete bloods so my father would need to attend an appointment at ED at 6pm to get these and any other investigations completed.  
When we arrived at ED the department was extremely busy. There was a queue of about 10 people waiting to speak to the reception staff (this level of queue continued for a large part of the following 5 hours). The waiting time for triage was 1 hour and following this 5hrs for minors and majors. The majority of people presenting at ED reported they had been sent there by primary care.  
Despite the pressures I can only commend the reception staff for their patience in dealing with this level of pressure, and finding creative solutions to support families whose first language is not English (eg "got a mobile? Show me your name on your phone.")  
As a health service worker I fully understand the COVID environment. The reception area was very busy. Every half hour until 8pm one of the nursing staff loudly announced that only patients should be in the reception area and that others should return to their cars to wait. While I fully understand her concern and frustration, it would perhaps have been helpful if she had added "unless the patient is a vulnerable patient - but please do give chairs to patients". I did not use a chair, but I wouldn't have left my 88 year old father alone in the waiting area.  
Additionally I challenged the request to wait outside while my father was triaged, and accompanied my father into triage. This was necessary as he needed support to hear information and retain it. The triage nurse completed her examination and was very kind and supportive.  
We had a long wait following triage. This was due in part to the very high number of attendees who had been sent to ED by primary care.  
When we were called through to see a doctor the service was exceptionally good. The doctor (Nathan) had excellent communication skills and spoke clearly and directly to my father. He also actively listened to what my father had to say. He displayed all of the HSC values and treated my father with kindness and compassion.  
A CT scan was arranged for the following morning and we returned at 9am, scan completed at 10am, given feedback from doctor and medication by 11.30am.  
In conclusion, I would like to thank all of the ED team at AAH for the work they do under the extreme pressures that currently exist in the system.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: dracoxh53
title: Health Check Up
body: After having a general health check about some concerns I had with aches and pains, I was happily surprised how professional and caring Pauline was - she is an angel. I have had a fear of blood tests for a while now and after having a not so nice experience at a private surgery in the city, Pauline was amazing. She took my blood calmly and quickly, I had no pain, no feeling like I wanted to faint... it was actually a pleasant experience! ! ! She did a thorough examination checking my weight, height and, did an ECG which all came out all good. She gave me valuable advice about the body as you get older which has put my mind at rest. She is a professional, kind person and if you ever have any fears about the doctors, blood, etc give Barton house a try. All the staff are very nice and caring and always do their best to help you.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: coordinationsn59
title: Having a miscarriage and waiting in pharmacy
body:
I started having pain and bleeding so phoned the GAU (gynae assessment unit). They gave me an appointment for the following day. Everyone was so kind to me and took really good care of me.  
I had to return to get the prescribed blood thinners and was given a prescription for the hospital pharmacy. There, I had to wait about 20 minutes to hand in the prescription and then over half an hour for the medication. It’s a very small room and it was hard to have to wait so long whilst bleeding.  
There was another lady there, who I also saw at GAU, who I suspect was going through the same, trying to fight back the tears.  
I don’t at all blame the staff, but maybe there could be a different system to prevent people like us having to wait in the pharmacy for so long?

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: An excellent local facility.
body: I received prompt, courteous and professional treatment at this small, welcoming and friendly hospital.

title: Excellent care
body:
Just to say a huge thank you to all the staff who looked after me during my stay after having a hysterectomy in March 2021. I could tell everyone was under huge pressure from the work load due to the pandemic but the dedication and care I had from all the staff you could not fault. 
Spending the weekend in hospital after having my operation on Friday the staff  worked constantly and the changing of Shifts were like clockwork. The constant post operation checks we’re like clockwork and I felt so well looked after and cared for.
So again thank you all for you dedication and commitment. I have recovered brilliantly and I cannot thank you all enough.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: No reply to E-consult
body:
Had an X-ray in August 2020, no one called me with the result.

I called 3 weeks later, was told I had degenerative osteoarthritus by the call handler but this person clearly wasn't medically trained when I asked questions so arranged a doctor to call me.
Doctor called and said he would refer me to a specialist.

In March 2021 I did an e-consult (as I could never get through on the phone) and asked for a referral letter so I could go private.
Not been contacted about it as of yet (27/05/2021).
I thought your policy was to make contact within 48 hours!

title: No PPE
body: Went for a consultation due to illness out of hours. Told I needed to go by myself and wear a mask which goes without saying. Entered building and walked a few metres when I came across security taking to a couple with no masks, went to reception and then sat down with another couple, again no masks! Bolton is in one of the highest regions for COVID cases and no wonder if our NHS are not following guidelines and making sure people are adhering to rules.  Went back out and security where sat on chairs talking to each other. Maybe a good idea to be stood by door making sure people are sticking to these rules! Disgraceful state of affairs,

title: Fantastic Teamwork DASU, ICU and the Stoma Care…
body: We would like to thank all the nurses and doctors on DASU and ICU for the care and support they gave my sister during her hospital stay. They worked closely with the family and carers to ensure her learning disability needs were met and showed care and compassion during some very challenging times. The support and training from the Stoma care team was outstanding, they listened to our concerns and helped us to understand how to support my sister post surgery. Thank you all.

title: Very helpful staff.
body: Had to contact surgery mum needed her burst cyst to be looked at. Very pleased with support given. In fact had to contact surgery a few times recently and have always been extremely pleased with care and advice given. Thank you very much.

title: Impossible
body: Impossible to see or speak to anyone. Attempted to make an appointment over 3 weeks ago. Was told no face-to-face appointments so it would have to be by phone only. The first appointment they had was 3 weeks later. Fast forward 3 weeks to appointment time and nobody has bothered to call. How long am I supposed to sit by the phone? Over an hour? I honestly have no idea how you are supposed to see or speak to any kind of medical professional at this surgery.

title: Non covid compliance where it's needed most!
body: I visited the A&E with a health issue upon arrival i was greeted by the doorman who insisted i sanitised my hands and wear a mask if i didnt have one already, this is all well and good until you get in A&E where the mask rule goes out of the window  with people using the masks as neck warmers instead of the intended purpose and apparently this isnt enforceable by either staff or security and they are not  allowed to enforce the mask rule incase it offends, im not sure whats happened here but i can see things going in one direction which is back to square one with more lock downs due to ignorance of both patients and staff when compliance is needed most.

title: Not responsive
body: After the start of pandemic, I could never visit my GP neither in person, nor by phone! It is very difficult to catch them. There is no option in my SystemOnline account to book an appointment with them! I have been very desperate from the start of the Pandemic without receiving ANY SUPPORT from them.

title: Very helpful doctor
body: I was really stressed out from my child's nose bleeds. Took him to A&E initially from excessive bleeding. However, they only gave an ointment for Nadal bacteria but did not stop the blood. Referral to ENT had to be done but waiting time was couple of months. The St. Stephens doctor called me back and listened to my worries. She then called the ENT department and got my child an ENT appointment for the following week. She also got the ENT to advise on a medication that will help the blood stop in the meantime. I was so touched and overwhelmed by this supportive doctor who went out of her way to help my child seen quickly. I have been so worried about my child and was ready to go A&E again. Thank you so much! Much appreciated!

title: The worst GP I have ever seen
body: Rushey Green is one of the worst GPs I have ever seen. The appointment booking process is very broken. The patients are not allowed to booked any appointments online and are only allowed to book appointment via phone call. After multiple days of trying, if the patient is lucky to get through, they can only book one for the day and if there are no appointment available, they have to call back again to book for a different day. The receptionist is not friendly and helpful which made it even more difficult. I can fully understand that we are going through COVID and it has been difficult for GPs. But the whole process of working with their patients in this GP is completely broken and not efficient at all. When I received my booking confirmation via phone message, it sent a completely wrong time so I missed my appointment. Finally when I was able to be there for my appointment, my GP was extremely disorganized, dropping things everywhere, aggressively pulling out the drawers and looking for things. It doesn't feel like it is professional at all. While I was waiting at the GP, there were other elderly patients physically came to the practice complaining that they weren't able to pass through the call to make an appointment and demanding to see a GP directly. They were very frustrated and I can completely feel their pain. We are in 21st centuries, please use internet and all the new technologies to improve the efficiency of the practice. This doesn't mean remove phone booking as there are people who will need to use this service. It is not like all NHS are suffering slow adoption of new technologies, there are other GPs that are absolutely benefiting from them. If anyone from Rushey Green GP can see this, please look after the patients in your practice, making the whole process difficult might reduce your issues within the GP, but will not help your patients.

title: Extremely reliable team
body: I have been with the surgery since 8 years and I find them extremely professional and helpful. I had only requested a referral request to be forwarded to the hospital via email the previous night & it was all sorted out before wake and I have a much needed appointment now. Thanks team Chelsfield, you’re the best.

title: Very good GP surgery
body: I’m so impressed by this surgery. My relative is unfortunately diagnosed with terminal cancer and we needed new medication for him late evening today. The receptionists were excellent, caring and understanding and took the details off me straightaway. They then spoke to the duty GP and within 10mins we got a call from the GP to say the medication was done and we got it straightaway. My relative is now feeling much better. Just outstanding service and excellent surgery. Thank you so much.

title: Thankyou
body:
There seems to be a lot of negative comments in the media regarding GP’s.
I just wanted to say the experience my husband and I have had with the practice in last 2 years has been excellent. All the staff receptionists, nurses and GP’s have provided an efficient caring service. Your hard work is appreciated, thankyou.

title: Great practice
body: I am very pleased with this surgery.  My family and I have been patients here for many years even before they moved. We have always found the doctors, nurses and reception staff to be very welcoming friendly and helpful. They always go out of their way to help my family and me. I would recommend this surgery to anyone. Keep up the good work.

title: Disabled parking spaces used by staff and estate…
body:
I have no choice but leave this review as i feel the hospital management dont care that  estate staff are using disabled spaces to park their vehicles in, this has happened numerous times and still goes unchallenged by hospital management, not only this i was forced to park outside the new A&E (the opposite side of the hospital to where i need to be) and their is a lift service van parked in a disabled space which isnt the first time its been there.
Is this kind of attitude the hospital has to people with disabilities? By allowing staff and maintenance vehicles to use valuable and in short supply disabled spaces???

title: Total lack of professionalism
body: I visited the emergency services because of some heavy bleeding and some abdominal cramps during a first trimester of pregnancy. I was referred to the early pregnancy unit for an emergency scan. 24 hours later I still hadn’t received any call from them. I repeatedly tried to call them but no one picked up and they do not respond to voice messages. It’s a disgrace to leave people anxious and to not provide the minimum care. Services don’t seem to communicate between them and there’s a total lack of professionalism

title: Fantastic Practice
body: The team are awesome they are so helpful professional and caring I don’t know what I would have done without them

title: Not fit for purpose
body: It was so simple when you could contact your own surgery - in my case Sunnyside Surgery Clevedon.  All personal contact seems to have been lost since the move to Mendip Vale

title: Lovely hospltal
body: Took wife to walk in centre with worrying leg pains, was seen quickly and reassured with a diagnosis that it was not serious. Lovely staff, very friendly. Well done,thank you.

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: Terrible
body: This is the worse practice l have been to, the reception staff are rude! they don’t know how to speak to people properly very unprofessional.

title: Very nice nurse and doctor
body: I was accompanying my mother to check on her hand, for she feels numbness from time to time, the doctor in the practice was very helpful and so is the nurse, now she feels much better, the booking and the telephone queuing time was reasonable. Keep up the good work!

title: First Rate Practice
body: I have used the practice for over ten years and always found it supportive and efficient. During that time I have had interactions with many different clinicians and administrative staff and have had no reason for complaint. Any requests for specialist consultations have been handled well and I have always found the reception staff friendly and professional.

title: Management at Location
body:
Arrived on time at Penkridge surgery and was initially asked to wait outside in the car park with no attempt to notify Health Harmony of my arrival. Was told that they would come and find me.
Upon noting my reluctance to comply a seat in the waiting area was offered on the proviso that if more than 5 people arrived I would then have to wait outside, Covid being the reason.
After pointing out that I had been waiting for 35 mins Penkridge surgery phoned the room that Health Harmony were using and told them of my arrival.
Being the end of day there was an expected delay in treatments and it would have been more professional to give an indication of this.

title: Exceptional Care and Practice
body: I have been with the Old Church Surgery for many years now, throughout this time the surgery has consistently been excellent. The surgery grows and flourishes with the times, and very much seeks to provide the best medical care and provision that it can. I attend clinics, appointments, visits to the Reception, telephone appointments and calls to the surgery and always the staff show excellent professional standards and care. My doctor is highly skilled, knowledgeable and professional, always providing excellent medical care, as well as explaining results, treatments and involving me in the discussion - which is empowering me as a patient to better understand a diagnosis and be confident in managing this. My family also are highly impressed with the medical care and treatment they receive at the surgery. Staff treat us with great dignity and respect, this I see is how they speak with all patients whenever I visit the surgery or pop in to collect a form. Just today, Friday 4th June when I rang and spoke with a member of staff she was caring, skilled, and efficient in dealing with my query and concern, which brought much reassurance to me as a patient.  I am impressed with the high standards of efficiency and organisation of the surgery, which has been maintained through the unprecedented circumstances due to the COVID-19 pandemic. I am extremely grateful and appreciative of all the doctors, nurses, receptionists and staff at The Old Church Surgery for their dedication, commitment and medical care for all. They are exceptional!

title: Great level of care
body: I recently attended the hospital for a colposcopy and was extremely nervous about it. I can't praise the staff enough, especially the two nurses in attendance, for making me feel as comfortable as possible and generally just being patient and kind. The whole procedure was efficiently but sensitively handled and it wasn't anywhere near as bad as I had imagined. The staff working in this department are a real credit to their profession. Thank you very much.
